com.blackshark.gamesdk

Class HapticManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blackshark.gamesdk.HapticManager

  • public class HapticManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that operates the haptic effect on device.
    Requires the android.permission.VIBRATE permission.

    • Method Detail

      • isAudio2HapticSupported

        public static boolean isAudio2HapticSupported()
        Returns whether the Audio to Haptic is supported on this device.
        Returns:
        return true if the device support Audio to Haptic.

      • setAudio2HapticActive

        public static void setAudio2HapticActive(android.content.Context context,
                                         boolean active)
        enable/disable Audio to Haptic. IMPORTANT: DO'NOT keep Audio2Haptic active all the time,
        it's better to enable Audio2Haptic just while action/event is happening in the game,
        like gun shot, boom, engine start.
        Example:
        call setAudio2HapticActive(true); before pull the trigger of the gun,
        call setAudio2HapticActive(false); after release the trigger
        Parameters:
        context -
        active - true to enable false to disable

      • vibrate

        public static void vibrate(android.content.Context context,
                           long[] pattern)
        Vibrate with a given pattern.
        Pass in an array of ints that are the durations for which to turn on or off the vibrator in milliseconds.
        The first value indicates the number of milliseconds to wait before turning the vibrator on.
        The next value indicates the number of milliseconds for which to keep the vibrator on before turning it off.
        Subsequent values alternate between durations in milliseconds to turn the vibrator off or to turn the vibrator on.
        Parameters:
        context -
        pattern - an array of longs of times for which to turn the vibrator on or off.
